entry.title: Optimizing Algorithms From Pairwise User Preferences

link.title: Optimizing Algorithms From Pairwise User Preferences

entry.content: We show how to perform efficient black-box optimization of algorithm configuration from user preferences. Results include Intel RealSense stereo cameras and a robot social navigation policy.
entry.summary: We show how to perform efficient black-box optimization of algorithm configuration from user preferences. Results include Intel RealSense stereo cameras and a robot social navigation policy.

entry.title: Discovering Multiple Algorithm Configurations
entry.content: We show the benefits of discovering an ensemble of configurations for a given algorithm during the course of optimization. Results on stereo, planning and visual odometry.
entry.summary: We show the benefits of discovering an ensemble of configurations for a given algorithm during the course of optimization. Results on stereo, planning and visual odometry.

entry.title: Fuzzy Metaballs: Approximate Differentiable Rendering with Algebraic Surfaces

link.title: Fuzzy Metaballs: Approximate Differentiable Rendering with Algebraic Surfaces

entry.content: An approximate differentiable renderer for a compact, interpretable representation, which we call Fuzzy Metaballs. Our approximate renderer focuses on rendering shapes via depth maps and silhouettes. It sacrifices fidelity for utility, producing fast runtimes and high-quality gradient information that can be used to solve vision tasks.
entry.summary: An approximate differentiable renderer for a compact, interpretable representation, which we call Fuzzy Metaballs. Our approximate renderer focuses on rendering shapes via depth maps and silhouettes. It sacrifices fidelity for utility, producing fast runtimes and high-quality gradient information that can be used to solve vision tasks.

entry.title: Venue Analytics: A Simple Alternative to Citation-Based Metrics

link.title: Venue Analytics: A Simple Alternative to Citation-Based Metrics

entry.content: A bibliometric/scientometric project. Our main two results are a method of assigning value to all venues in computer science and a method to organize them into distinct subfields, all without using citation data. The resulting venue scores can be used to rank universities’ by scholarly output, and produce a responsive author-level metric.
entry.summary: A bibliometric/scientometric project. Our main two results are a method of assigning value to all venues in computer science and a method to organize them into distinct subfields, all without using citation data. The resulting venue scores can be used to rank universities’ by scholarly output, and produce a responsive author-level metric.

entry.title: Direct Fitting of Gaussian Mixture Models

link.title: Direct Fitting of Gaussian Mixture Models

entry.content: A formulation for fitting Gaussian Mixture Models (GMMs) directly to geometric objects, such as a triangular mesh. This method produces more robust results and produces an improvement in 3D registration for both meshes and RGB-D frames.
entry.summary: A formulation for fitting Gaussian Mixture Models (GMMs) directly to geometric objects, such as a triangular mesh. This method produces more robust results and produces an improvement in 3D registration for both meshes and RGB-D frames.

entry.title: Dice Stacking: A Dynamic Manipulation Task

link.title: Dice Stacking: A Dynamic Manipulation Task

entry.content:
With Hunter Goforth, we designed a manipulation task and solved it with imitation learning.

With Chris Atkeson and Alex Spitzer. Using optimizers to match an observed trajectory.
entry.summary: With Hunter Goforth, we designed a manipulation task and solved it with imitation learning.

entry.title: Introspective Neural Networks
entry.content:
Using pre-trained neural networks to improve fine grained recognition via style transfer.

With Chris Atkeson and Alex Spitzer. Using optimizers to match an observed trajectory.
entry.summary: Using pre-trained neural networks to improve fine grained recognition via style transfer.

entry.content:
Using a very simple algorithm to solve some very simple environments

With Chris Atkeson and Alex Spitzer. Using optimizers to match an observed trajectory.
